Is there any way for me to get the newer (V 2.6) parts without depreciating the old general launch bases?

Hello, 

I've run into an issue where my FPS is slowing to a crawl/ the game is freezing for seconds at a time up until the point that I launch and release the clamps, then everything runs fine. The issue is worst with the Saturn MLP, but it seems to be happening to varying degrees with other Modular Launch Pads parts too. I've used this mod for years with a significantly inferior PC with no issues and recently upgraded computers. I did the install through CKAN and I removed all IVA related mods since I saw some discussion about issues earlier in the thread. Any idea what could be causing this? 

 

Edited May 12 by bacontornado

Edited May 13 by bacontornado

5 hours ago, bacontornado said:

Hello, 

I've run into an issue where my FPS is slowing to a crawl/ the game is freezing for seconds at a time up until the point that I launch and release the clamps, then everything runs fine. The issue is worst with the Saturn MLP, but it seems to be happening to varying degrees with other Modular Launch Pads parts too. I've used this mod for years with a significantly inferior PC with no issues and recently upgraded computers. I did the install through CKAN and I removed all IVA related mods since I saw some discussion about issues earlier in the thread. Any idea what could be causing this? 

 

Update: It seems like Universal Storage II was the culprit. I did a clean install with an, almost, identical mod list and copied my save over. I still ran into the issue when I loaded the craft I was using with the MLP, but I tried something generic in sandbox with the Saturn MLP and it worked fine. So I went back to my save and loaded the craft and started removing moded parts. The craft had a Universal Storage service module and removing that fixed the issue. This was the first craft this career where I tried to use the Saturn MLP, but I looked at other craft I had used that had issues with other Modular Launch Pads and they all had Universal Storage parts. I've removed that mod and all seems good now. 

Edited May 13 by bacontornado

@AlphaMensae would it be possible to get a variant of the small and medium launch bases without the wheels? Would make them a lot more general use

19 hours ago, Jacktical said:

@AlphaMensae would it be possible to get a variant of the small and medium launch bases without the wheels? Would make them a lot more general use  

They were designed to be a mobile platform, so that's why they only have wheels. The Small base was in fact intended for Atlas V and Ariane 5, both of which use a mobile platform.

Did a point update release, v2.6.2

  • Revamp of the included craft files. Removed the mod rocket parts to create Bare Assemblies with only the Modular Launch Pads parts. Moved the Stock Examples into a separate folder. Added some RSS-RO examples in another folder

Many of the old mod rocket files were becoming broken, and with more getting broken as the mods continue to make major changes to their parts,  I didn't want to update them, so I decided to just get rid of the mod parts and leave the MLP parts as a "Bare Assembly". No rocket is included, just attach the assembly to the designated rocket (the Merge function should make this easy).

I added another Stock Example file; these use only stock parts and are not meant to be good designs but just to show how to put th MLP parts together. I also added some examples for RSS-RO, ones I've launched in my sandbox RSS-RO install.

The craft files are now in their own separate folders under "Craft Files" in the .zip, so you don't put RSS-RO files in a stock install and vice-versa.

Edited June 9 by AlphaMensae
